standard_metadata.standard_description: Know that numbers that are not rational are called irrational. Understand informally that every number has a decimal expansion; for rational numbers show that the decimal expansion repeats eventually, and convert a decimal expansion which repeats eventually into a rational number.

question.content: **Is the following number rational or irrational?**  $0.692$

hints.content: A rational number is any number that can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
All terminating decimals can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
$0.692$ can be expressed as $\dfrac{692}{1000}$.
Rational

question.content: **Is the following number rational or irrational?**  $9.0$

hints.content: A rational number is any number that can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
All terminating decimals can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
$9.0$ can be expressed as $\dfrac{9}{1}$.
Rational

question.content: **Is the following number rational or irrational?**  $7.11$

hints.content: A rational number is any number that can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
All terminating decimals can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
$7.11$ can be expressed as $\dfrac{711}{100}$.
Rational

question.content: **Is the following number rational or irrational?**  $6\dfrac 12$

hints.content: A rational number is any number that can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
All mixed numbers can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
$6\dfrac 12$ can be expressed as $\dfrac{13}{2}$.
Rational

question.content: **Is the following number rational or irrational?**  $-\dfrac{13}{12}$

hints.content: A rational number is any number that can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
$-\dfrac{13}{12}$ can be expressed as $\dfrac{-13}{12}$.
Rational

question.content: **Is the following number rational or irrational?**  $0.5555$

hints.content: A rational number is any number that can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
All terminating decimals can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
$0.5555$ can be expressed as $\dfrac{5555}{10{,}000}$.
Rational

question.content: **Is the following number rational or irrational?**  $-\dfrac{501}{502}$

hints.content: A rational number is any number that can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
$-\dfrac{501}{502}$ can be expressed as $\dfrac{-501}{502}$.
Rational

question.content: **Is the following number rational or irrational?**  $0.\overline7$

hints.content: A rational number is any number that can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
All repeating decimals can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
$0.\overline{7}$ can be expressed as $\dfrac{7}{9}$.
Rational

question.content: **Is the following number rational or irrational?**  $-0.\overline{32}$

hints.content: A rational number is any number that can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
All repeating decimals can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
$-0.\overline{32}$ can be expressed as $\dfrac{-32}{99}$.
Rational

question.content: **Is the following number rational or irrational?**  $0.\overline{151}$

hints.content: A rational number is any number that can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
All repeating decimals can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
$0.\overline{151}$ can be expressed as $\dfrac{151}{999}$.
Rational

question.content: **Is the following number rational or irrational?**  $6.\overline6$

hints.content: A rational number is any number that can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
All repeating decimals can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
$6.\overline6$ is equivalent to $6\dfrac{6}{9}$ which can be expressed as $\dfrac{60}{9}$.
Rational

question.content: **Is the following number rational or irrational?**  $\sqrt{121}$

hints.content: A rational number is any number that can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
All square roots of perfect squares can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
$\sqrt{121}$ is equivalent to $11$ which can be expressed as $\dfrac{11}{1}$.
Rational

question.content: **Is the following number rational or irrational?**  $\sqrt{64}$

hints.content: A rational number is any number that can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
All square roots of perfect squares can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
$\sqrt{64}$ is equivalent to $8$ which can be expressed as $\dfrac{8}{1}$.
Rational

question.content: **Is the following number rational or irrational?**  $\dfrac{0.4}{0.8}$

hints.content: A rational number is any number that can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
All fractions of terminating decimals can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
$\dfrac{0.4}{0.8}$ can be expressed as $\dfrac{4}{8}$.
Rational

question.content: **Is the following number rational or irrational?**  $\dfrac{0.3}{0.9}$

hints.content: A rational number is any number that can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
All fractions of terminating decimals can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
$\dfrac{0.3}{0.9}$ can be expressed as $\dfrac{3}{9}$.
Rational

question.content: **Is the following number rational or irrational?**  $\sqrt{32}$

hints.content: A rational number is any number that can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
$\sqrt{32}$ is an irrational number because it is the square root of a non-perfect square. Square roots of non-perfect squares *cannot* be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
Irrational

question.content: **Is the following number rational or irrational?**  $\sqrt{50}$

hints.content: A rational number is any number that can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
$\sqrt{50}$ is an irrational number because it is the square root of a non-perfect square.  Square roots of non-perfect squares *cannot* be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
Irrational

question.content: **Is the following number rational or irrational?**  $ \pi-1$

hints.content: A rational number is any number that can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.

$\pi - 1$ is an irrational number because it has an infinite decimal expansion that does not repeat. Numbers that have infinite decimal expansions that do not repeat *cannot* be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
Irrational

question.content: **Is the following number rational or irrational?**  $ 0.3\pi$

hints.content: A rational number is any number that can be expressed as the fraction of two integers.

$0.3\pi$ is an irrational number because it has an infinite decimal expansion that does not repeat. Numbers that have infinite decimal expansions that do not repeat *cannot* be expressed as the fraction of two integers.
Irrational
